SENT.plain: Systemic-onset juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA) is a complex disease which affects many organ systems
Associated renal lesions are unusual, with the possible exception of amyloidosis
We describe a girl with systemic-onset JRA who developed first membranous nephropathy and then, 3.5 years later, a severe crescentic glomerulonephritis
The membranous lesion followed therapy with intravenous immune globulin, and the possibility that this intervention caused the renal disease must be considered
It appears that both of these lesions should be added to the list of possible complications of systemic-onset JRA
